1024x768 Clean false false false EN-US X-NONE X-NONE MicrosoftInternetExplorer4 Hi Chris,
You are correct, there is a monthly premium and a $5000 out of pocket deductible that must be met before any coverage kicks in. It is similar to an HAS plan an employer would offer, only instead of us offering a pre-tax savings account you can contribute to, you have the ability to submit up to $10,000 per year in out of pocket medical expenses for a tax deduction. This would allow you to get some of those out of pocket cost back in the form of a tax deduction. I agree that our plan doesn’t seem like the best option which is why we give consultants the option of whether or not to join the plan or find coverage on their own. The benefit is that it is group plan so you are not subject to going through underwriting and you cannot be dropped from the plan due to making too many medical claims (and the premiums cannot be raised for the same reason which happens with an individual plan often). That being said, our plan will always be more expensive than many individual plans or plans you can get through a traditional employer (due to our small percentage of participation and high claims of that small pool of participants,) and you are welcome to find insurance outside of our program and you can then write off the monthly premium as an expense in our system monthly.
Please let me know if you have any additional questions about this.
Have a great weekend, Nicolette
